module.p: a-nis now is a temporal adverb.
Alternative forms – a-nise, a-nist (a-nisd), a-niste. cf. an-dràsta now, at the moment, at present.

Corpus examples –
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. Cuin a chualas ball-Pàrlamaid a’ togail a ghuth a dh’ iarraidh leasachaidh do staid Gàidhlig ann an Albainn? Am bi cothrom a nis aig cuideigin a ghuth a thogail, anns an t-suidheachadh iongantach a th’ againn anns a’ Phàrlamaid ùr? [...]
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. When has a member of Parliament been heard raising his voice to demand improvement for the state of Gaelic in Scotland? Will someone have an opportunity now to raise his voice, in the unexpected situation we have in the new Parliament? [...] td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’

Corpus examples –
[...] A nis, tha an Taghadh Nàiseanta seachad, agus tha Riaghaltas ùr againn. Tha sinn an dòchas gun téid gu math dhaibh, agus gun cuir iad spionnadh ás ùr anns an dùthaich air fad. Agus gu seachd àraidh anns a’ Ghaidhealtachd: [...]
[...] Now, the General Election is behind us, and we have a new Government. We hope that they will do well, and that they will re-energise the whole country. And most especially [in] the Highlands: [...] td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’

Biblical examples –
A Nis is iad so ainmeanna chloinn Israeil, a thàinig do’n Eiphit; thàinig gach duine agus a theaghlach maille re Iacob: Reuben, Simeon, Lebhi, agus Iudah, [...] Agus na h-anman uile a thàinig a mach a leasraidh Iacoib, bu deich agus tri fichead anam iad; oir bha Ioseph ’san Eiphit a cheana. [...]
Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob. Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, [...] And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already. [KJV] Ecsodus I.1–5

Corpus examples –
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. Cuin a chualas ball-Pàrlamaid a’ togail a ghuth a dh’ iarraidh leasachaidh do staid Gàidhlig ann an Albainn? Am bi cothrom a nis aig cuideigin a ghuth a thogail, anns an t-suidheachadh iongantach a th’ againn anns a’ Phàrlamaid ùr? [...] Có a nis a chuireas fead chruaidh ann an cluais Luchd an Ionmhais ann a Westminster?
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. When has a member of Parliament been heard raising his voice to demand improvement for the state of Gaelic in Scotland? Will someone have an opportunity now to raise his voice, in the unexpected situation we have in the new Parliament? [...] Who now will put a hard whistle [?] in the ear of the Finance People in Westminster? td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’ immediately following an interrogative particle
